channel.title: CVE Feed for Brocade Communications Systems, Inc. -- Brocade SANnav
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Brocade Communications Systems, Inc. -- Brocade SANnav

item.title: CVE-2019-16206|2024-08-05T01:10:41.537Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: The authentication mechanism, in Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0, logs plaintext account credentials at the ‘trace’ and the 'debug' logging level; which could allow a local authenticated attacker to access sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2019-16210|2024-08-05T01:10:41.471Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0, logs plain text database connection password while triggering support save.

item.title: CVE-2019-16208|2024-08-05T01:10:41.542Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: Password-based encryption (PBE) algorithm, of Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0, has a weakness in generating cryptographic keys that may allow an attacker to decrypt passwords used with several services (Radius, TACAS, etc.).

item.title: CVE-2019-16207|2024-08-05T01:10:41.592Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0 use a hard-coded password, which could allow local authenticated attackers to access a back-end database and gain privileges.

item.title: CVE-2019-16209|2024-08-05T01:10:41.681Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: A vulnerability, in The ReportsTrustManager class of Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0, could allow an attacker to perform a man-in-the-middle attack against Secure Sockets Layer(SSL)connections.

item.title: CVE-2019-16205|2024-08-05T01:10:41.612Z -- brocade%20communications%20systems%2C%20inc. -- brocade%20sannav
item.description: A vulnerability, in Brocade SANnav versions before v2.0, could allow remote attackers to brute-force a valid session ID. The vulnerability is due to an insufficiently random session ID for several post-authentication actions in the SANnav portal.
